se.cbb.jprime.seqevo

Class SubstitutionModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.seqevo.SubstitutionModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sampleable, Dependent, InfoProvider, Model, ProperDependent

    public class SubstitutionModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements Model
    Implements the standard (probabilistic) Markov model for the substitution process of sequence evolution for any type of aligned sequence data, see e.g., Felsenstein 1981.

    Sequence positions with identical state patterns over leaves are identified and counted. Rate variation across sites over discrete classes, e.g., Yang 1993, can be modelled.

    This model does not yet support partitions of data into user-defined "independent" loci (domains, codon positions, etc.). NOTE: This class is derived from the C++ class CacheSubstitutionModel and not FastCacheSubstitutionModel since the latter was stated unsuitable for tree topology changes in the C++ CMake default settings. /Joel

    Author:
    Bengt Sennblad., Lars Arvestad., Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubstitutionModel

        public SubstitutionModel(java.lang.String name,
                 MSAData D,
                 GammaSiteRateHandler siteRates,
                 SubstitutionMatrixHandler Q,
                 RBTree T,
                 NamesMap names,
                 DoubleMap branchLengths,
                 boolean useRootArc)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - model name.
        D - sequence data (MSA).
        siteRates - site rate categories.
        Q - data transition matrix Q (and P).
        T - tree.
        names - leaf names of T.
        branchLengths - branch lengths of T.
        useRootArc - if true, utilises the root arc ("stem") branch length when computing model likelihood; if false, discards the root arc.

    • Method Detail

      • cacheAndUpdate

        public void cacheAndUpdate(java.util.Map<Dependent,ChangeInfo> changeInfos,
                  boolean willSample)
        Description copied from interface: ProperDependent
        Caches and updates this object. It may be assumed that this method will only be invoked if a parent has in fact changed.
        Input: All changes made so far, i.e., changes to dependent objects which precede this in the dependency DAG.
        Output: Changes made to this object are added to the input.

        Behaviour must adhere to the following:

        1. This objects queries input for change info of its parents.
        2. This object caches.
        3. This object sets its own change info (null if it has not changed).
        4. Exit.
        Specified by:
        cacheAndUpdate in interface ProperDependent
        Parameters:
        changeInfos - all changes made so far, including those of this objects parents, if any (null is interpreted as no change).
        willSample - true if the pending state will be sampled; false if not sampled. Invariant over any cacheAndUpdate()-clearCache()/restoreCache() cycle.

        public void clearCache(boolean willSample)

      • restoreCache

        public void restoreCache(boolean willSample)
        Description copied from interface: ProperDependent
        Restores the cached state when a proposed state has been rejected. It may be assumed that this method will only be invoked if a parent has in fact changed. Note that if the willSample flag is true, it may be necessary to do additional pre-processing on the restored state (since it probably originates from an earlier non-sample iteration).
        Specified by:
        restoreCache in interface ProperDependent
        Parameters:
        willSample - true if the pending state will be sampled; false if not sampled. Invariant over any cacheAndUpdate()-clearCache()/restoreCache() cycle.
